meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! Time to dive into the wonderful world of Read Only Memories: NEURODIVER, where memories are a thing of beauty and technology is a thing of... well, mostly wonder. But let's get down to business – I'm not here to give you the full 411 on this game; that's what those other critics are for (more on them later). I'm here to give you the lowdown, with a dash of sass and a pinch of humor.

First off, let me just say that NEURODIVER has got some serious style going on. The visuals are top-notch, with a futuristic setting that's straight out of a cyberpunk dreamscape. And don't even get me started on the characters – they're so lovable, you'll want to give them all a big hug (or a stern talking-to, depending on your mood).

Now, let's talk about those other critics. I mean, Slant Magazine says this game is an "immense, far-reaching embarrassment of creative options that the game is largely either unwilling or unequipped to tap into." Ouch, burn! Meanwhile, God is a Geek thinks it's a "wonderful sci-fi romp" and gives it a glowing 95. Yeah, I'm pretty sure those two aren't exactly on the same page.

And then there are the critics who give us some... mixed signals. RPG Fan says that NEURODIVER left them feeling "uncertain" – which is code for "I liked it, but didn't love it." Noisy Pixel thinks it's a "fun, upbeat story" with lovable characters, but also feels like something was missing. Yeah, I get that vibe too.

Shacknews gives us some hope, saying that NEURODIVER has a "pitch-perfect execution on its premise" and is just one or two tweaks away from being an all-timer. And Gamers Heroes agrees, calling it a "fantastic futuristic experience." Yay, team!

But let's not forget our resident curmudgeon, Checkpoint Gaming – they're like the fun police of game reviews. They give NEURODIVER a 65 and call it out for being underwhelming and disappointing. Ouch, burn! (Just kidding, I love that guy.)

All in all, Read Only Memories: NEURODIVER is a wild ride with some serious ups and downs. But hey, if you're looking for a game that's got style, heart, and some seriously cool characters – then this might just be the one for you.

Hippo Penny out!
